Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to work on feeling better and finding a sense of purpose again.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports feeling a bit more hopeful lately but still experiences low days.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been reconnecting with old friends, which has been a source of support and comfort.
Risk Assessment: The patient feels nervous about reaching out for volunteer opportunities, fearing rejection or not fitting in.
Physiological Observations: The patient feels more energized in the morning, which may support their yoga practice.
Current Functional Status: The patient has started doing yoga and is considering reaching out to volunteer organizations.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress by engaging in yoga and reconnecting with friends, indicating positive movement towards their goals.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to establish a routine for yoga and to focus on their strengths when considering volunteer work.
Next Steps: The patient plans to try morning yoga and aims to reach out to a volunteer organization by the end of the week.
